snippet: Kim Dotcom, the founder of Megaupload, will be in court on Friday to appeal a ruling denying him bail.
abstract: Kim Dotcom, the founder of Megaupload, will be in court on Friday to appeal a ruling denying him bail.
lead_paragraph: Coldplay streams, after three months: When Coldplay released its latest album, "Mylo Xyloto," in October, the band withheld it from streaming services like Spotify to spur download sales; as recently as last month, the band's manager, Dave Holmes, said he was "very concerned" that such services, which let fans listen to music free or through low monthly subscriptions, compete with more lucrative iTunes sales. Three months later, "Mylo Xyloto" has finally come to Spotify, Rhapsody, MOG and others. The Black Keys, however, another prominent holdout, has not made its latest album, "El Camino," available for streaming.

headline.main: Digital Notes: Coldplay Finally Streams and Saving Megaupload Files
